Markdown Syntax Guide Heading Level ğŸ“– Definition
The heading level can be set from 1 to 6 and its font size is from large to small.
Use the ‘#’ symbol followed by a space at the beginning of a line to define a heading, with more symbols indicating smaller levels.
âœ Write a Sample
# Heading level 1 ... ###### Heading level 6	ğŸ’»Preview
This is level 3 this is level 6 Line Break ğŸ“–Definition
Add two or more spaces followed by an Enter to create a new line.
âœ Write a Sample
This is the first line. And this is the second line.	ğŸ’»Preview
This is the first line.
And this is the second line.
Emphasis 1. Text Bold ğŸ“–Definition
Add two asterisks or underscores at the beginning and end of a word or statement.
âœ Write a Sample
I just love **bold text**. I just love __bold text__.	ğŸ’»Preview
I just love bold text.
I just love bold text.
2. Text Italic ğŸ“–Definition
Add one asterisk or underscore at the beginning and end of a word or statement.
âœ Write a Sample
Italicized text is the *cat's meow*. Italicized text is the _cat's meow_. ğŸ’»Preview
Italicized text is the cat’s meow.
Italicized text is the cat’s meow.
3. Text Blod and Italic ğŸ“–Definition
Add three asterisks or underscores at the beginning and end of a word or statement.
Either combine two asterisks with one underscores or two underscores with one asterisk.
âœ Write a Sample
This text is ***really important***. This text is ___really important___. This text is **_really important_**. This text is __*really important*__. ğŸ’»Preview
This text is really important.
This text is really important.
This text is really important.
This text is really important.
Text Color ğŸ“–Description
Use the HTML grammer to set font colors.
âœ Write a Sample
<font color=Red>Test1</font> <font color=#0000FF>Test2</font> <font style=background:red>Test3</font> ğŸ’»Preview
Test1
Test2
Test3
Text Strikethrough ğŸ“–Definition
Add two tilde symbols at the beginning and end of the word or statement.
âœ Write a Sample
~~The world is flat.~~ We now know that the world is round. ğŸ’»Preview
The world is flat.
We now know that the world is round.
Blockquotes ğŸ“–Definition
Add a ‘>’ (greater than) symbol in front of a statement.
For multiple paragraphs. Add a > on the blank lines between the paragraphs.
âœ Write a Sample
> Dorothy followed her through many of the beautiful rooms in her castle. > > The Witch bade her clean the pots and kettles and sweep the floor and keep the fire fed with wood. ğŸ’»Preview
Dorothy followed her through many of the beautiful rooms in her castle.
The Witch bade her clean the pots and kettles and sweep the floor and keep the fire fed with wood.
Lists 1. Ordered Lists ğŸ“–Definition
Add line items with numbers followed by periods.
The numbers don’t have to be in numerical order, but the list should start with the number one.
âœ Write a Sample
1. First item 2. Second item 3. Third item 1. Indented item 1. Indented item 4. Fourth item ğŸ’»Preview
First item Second item Third item Indented item Indented item Fourth item 2. Unordered Lists ğŸ“–Definition
Add dashes (-), asterisks (*), or plus (+) in front of line items.
âœ Write a Sample
* First item * 1968\. A great year! * Third item ğŸ’»Preview
First item 1968. A great year! Third item Horizontal Line ğŸ“–Definition
Add three dashes (-), asterisks (*), or underscores (_) on a line by themselves.
âœ Write a Sample
*** --- ___ ğŸ’»Preview
Links 1. With Title ğŸ“–Definition
Enclose the content of title in quotation marks after the URL.
âœ Write a Sample
My favorite search engine is [Duck Duck Go](https://duckduckgo.com "The best search engine for privacy"). ğŸ’»Preview
My favorite search engine is Duck Duck Go.
2. Literal URL and Email ğŸ“–Definition
Enclose the content in angle brackets.
âœ Write a Sample
<https://www.markdownguide.org> <fake@example.com> ğŸ’»Preview
https://www.markdownguide.org
fake@example.com
3. Internal Section ğŸ“–Definition
Enclose the heading Id in the parentheses.
âœ Write a Sample
click this [jump to the With Tile](#1-with-title) ğŸ’»Preview
click this jump to the With Tile
4. Disable Auto URL Linking ğŸ“–Definition
Denoting the URL as code with backticks.
âœ Write a Sample
`http://www.example.com` ğŸ’»Preview
http://www.example.com
Images ğŸ“–Definition
Enclose the path of the image in brackets, and then add the link in parentheses.
âœ Write a Sample
![destImg](./assets/images/tux.jpg "beautiful") ğŸ’»Preview
Escaping Characters ğŸ“–Definition
Add a backslash (\) in front of the character.
âœ Write a Sample
\* Without the backslash, this would be a bullet in an unordered list. ğŸ’»Preview
* Without the backslash, this would be a bullet in an unordered list.
Embeded HTML Tags ğŸ“–Definition
Place the tags in the text of your Markdown-formatted file.
âœ Write a Sample
This **word** is bold. This <em>word</em> is italic. ğŸ’»Preview
This word is bold. This word is italic.
Tables ğŸ“–Definition
Use three or more hyphens (—) to create each column’s header, and use pipes (|) to separate each column.
Align text in the columns to the left, right, or center by adding a colon (:) to the left, right, or on both side of the hyphens within the header row.
âœ Write a Sample
| Syntax | Description | Test Text | | :--- | :----: | ---: | | Header | Title | Here's this | | Paragraph | Text | And more | ğŸ’»Preview
Syntax Description Test Text Header Title Here’s this Paragraph Text And more Fenced Code Blocks ğŸ“–Definition
Use three backticks (```) or three tildes (~~~) on the lines before and after the code block.
Specify a language next to the backticks before the fenced code block to highlight codes.
âœ Write a Sample
```json { "firstName": "John", "lastName": "Smith", "age": 25 } ``` ğŸ’»Preview
{ "firstName": "John", "lastName": "Smith", "age": 25 }
